reviews.text: Arriving at the hotel after a 19 hours direct flight from NY, I was really looking forward to a nice comfy bed for a quick nap. Despite the 11AM arrival, I was quickly checked in and was shown to my room quickly.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is about the same size as the one that I had from the Pan Pacific that is close by. It is however a bit smaller than the one from the Grand Hyatt. The bed is a bit on the soft side but otherwise
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a central location

reviews.text: comfortable. The view from my room is slightly better than the Pan Pacific but not by much.
reviews.title: Good enough without being outstanding

reviews.text: The marble/granite bathroom also have the same separate bathtub and shower although it is a bit smaller than Pan Pacific and also a bit more worn out. The amenities are good without being as exciting as the Grand Hyatt offerings.
reviews.title: Great value, good location, perfect for Suntec participants
Not as good as expected
reviews.text: There are a quartet playing music in the atrium every night just like the Pan Pacific and the same bird chirping in the morning. The bird songs are quite soothing for a morning wakeup call.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a deluxe double for $187 per night and they offer me a upgrade to Meritus Club room (2nd highest level) for another $80 last year on both my wife and my birthdays.
reviews.title: Great bathroom and almost everything!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their service is first class however they put us to a room which is smoking despite my advance request and my wife is sensitive to cigarette smell. Anyway they immediately asked the housekeeping to improve the situation for us.
reviews.title: Classy hotel

reviews.text: The view of the sea through the room was breath-taking. There is a wonderful coffee maker, special mist shower, great bathtub etc etc. Everything was almost perfect there.
reviews.title: Good but could be better

reviews.text: We even got a free birthday cake and wine as requested.
reviews.title: Good and comfy, just a bit outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have a memorable birthday 2010 and wish that they contact me again if they got very special promotion again. This time I would take good photos about my stay!
reviews.title: complete rip-off

reviews.text: Have stayed at the Marina Mandarin last week for 5 days. Stayed on the 9th floor, deluxe room. Simple rooms which could use a bit of a refurbishment but service wise top notch. From the Main entrance till up to the room every staff is very friendly and all I see is big smiles.
reviews.title: amazing and simply fabulous

reviews.text: Concierge & Reception are extremely effecient and I have felt a home!. I have stayed at other 5 star hotels in Singapore, Marriott, 4 seasons, The oriental etc, which are nice as well but nothing close to the service level at the Marina Mandarin. I will certainly return whenever my work brings me to singapore.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel

reviews.text: After an earlier stay at the Marina Bay Sands, the Marina Mandarin was like coming home.
reviews.title: Not that impressive

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly the rooms comfortable and convenient eating and shopping all around.
reviews.title: Very decent business hotel

reviews.text: Huge hotel, impeccably clean. Location is great, but SDG100/day internet. Am also surprised nobody picks up the phone when calling guest services from the room (tried 3 times and gave up).
reviews.title: great service, good rooms

reviews.text: Stayed at The Marina Mandarin in Nov 06 for 5 nights with great promotion from expedia and I don't have much to complain about really. While checking in, I asked for a room with a nice view and was provided with a 14th floor corner room overlooking the Marina and The Oriental was right opposite - fantastic choice. The only downside was the walk from lifts as I had to walk in a big square shape every morning and night!
reviews.title: Good experience

likes.liked: — The stunning view of my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room has been partly renovated and was in a suitable size and good condition. Some pieces of furniture looked tired, but wasnt a big deal. Bathroom was clean and spacious but looked kind of late 80's. I agree with every reviews below about the noise from the lobby area which sometimes the songs could put me to deep sleep and sometimes it could be a little frustrating.
reviews.title: Wow! Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: The location is perfect in terms of physical comfort. Restaurants and shops in Marina Square were easily reached and if you need to take a cab, there is always one - I never ever had to wait for it.
reviews.title: Overall, a Good but Not Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Noise in the rooms from the 4th Floor Lounge

reviews.title: Horible!
reviews.text: The spa was amazing. The atmosphere was so serene and I just loved going there for treatments. The rates were not friendly but service was spot on - highly recommended.

reviews.title: "Party Hotel" -- Not for family with young kids or babies!
reviews.text: The two problems I came across while staying at the hotel were the conceirge and the crowd. I was a solo traveller and hardly know anyone in town so when I was asking for crucial information, this man seems to always be rushing to do something and never let me finished my sentence. I just got fed up with the service so I helped myself with the directions in the end. As for the crowd, there were wedding receptions held at the hotel twice during my stay which made it troublesome getting in and out from the main entrance.

Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, and found the rooms to be great. My room was quite large and had a great view. The staff are also exceedingly helpful and friendly. I asked for quite a number of random things at various times from housekeeping, and they always obliged, though it might take a while. Unfortunately, I think they may be understaffed as their response was enver very timely.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while on business in Singapore. While the hotel doesn't look particularly inspiring from the outside, it is very impressive inside. It's well located and connected to a shopping mall with an excellent and very reasonably priced food hall. Internet access was excellent. Was able to say goodnight to kids back in Sydney face to face every night, and one small issue i had with internet access was promptly and efficiently resolved by hotel staff.My room was large and very comfortable. My only gripe was that the room wasn't made up until mid-afternoon, but it wasn't a big issue. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and staff eager to please

reviews.text: The view of our room overlooking the Marina and looking directly at the Sky Park was amazing. Both room and bathroom were very spacious, however both were looking tired and the shower needed better cleaning. The pool is huge but it too is looking tired and is over chlorinated. The concierge and clerks were extremely helpful and very friendly all were very knowledgeable and able to assist with all of our requests.
reviews.title: Million dollar view, looking well used

reviews.text: The hotel is overpriced and overrated but overall our stay was very pleasant. We read some complaints about the reception being on the 4th floor, we didn't find this an inconvenience at all as the lifts are quick easy to get to.
reviews.title: 4 star hotel with 2 star customer service posing as 5 star

reviews.text: I stayed here for business for 4 days in October. I was very disappointed by this hotel. Like other reviews state, the bathrooms have mold, the hotel is largely trapped in the 80s, although the rooms have been updated, and slow elevators. The big problem, however, is the customer service. It is very, very bad. The staff are rude. I interacted with many of them over the course of my stay, and all of them seem to be unhappy and agitated. The service is not 5 star service.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but there are better hotels nearby.
Acceptable, but not quite to expectations
reviews.text: I had high expectations of the Marina Mandarin, but unfortunately the overall experience fell slightly short of those expectations.
The hotel is in a very convenient location right next to Marina Square and Suntec city. Our room on the 13th floor had a nice view from the balcony across the Esplanade to the high rises downtown.
reviews.title: What a great hotel...

reviews.text: On arrival we were efficiently greeted at the door and our bags taken care of.
reviews.title: Five Day Business Trip -- Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Lobby is sowewhat dark and dated

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: On check in we were informed that no non smoking room was available with a king bed, but that a twin room was available. I was happy to accept the smoking room on the basis that we could switch to the non smoking twin if neccessary. I was also assured that the smell in the room would not be too bad and if it was to call reception to change.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were escorted to the room which stank of stale cigar smoke, and was non too clean. Ash was present all around the chair arms, and the glass table had the remains of the previous occupants room service stuck in the groove around the glass.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: This is a great hotel, close to Orchard Road and the Marina bay area... Cracking atrium when you first walk in and the service is great. The hotel itself was very clean throughout, although the rooms perhaps a bit dated. Having said that, the bathroom was great with powerful shower and lovely deep bath (if those sorts of things are important to you!) The pool area is clean and family friendly, and much needed when staying in Singapore! Great balcony overlooking the business hub, and would definitely stay again when next in Singapore.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

likes.liked: — Great bathroom facilities and bath robes/slippers etc

reviews.text: This hotel is shocking, we arrived at the hotel at 4am, no porter staff around to help with our bags so we had to struggle up to the 4th floor where we found the reception. It felt like the hotel had switched off the air conditioning as it was very hot in the lobby. Check-in took a very long time 30+ mins and we certainly didn’t get that normal Singaporean welcome that I always receive at the Sheraton Towers. So at about 5am we struggled up to our room on the seventh floor only to find that the room was dirty and had not been serviced from a previous guest. So we walked back to the front desk only to wait another 30 mins before begin allocated another room, the reception staff were so unhelpful and didn’t even apologies for any inconvenience. So we went up to our new room to find that it was a double room with 2 single beds, instead of the king room that we had booked. (Why didn’t the staff ask if this was ok?) I called down to reception a third time only to wait another 15mins while they played around with their computers to be told that this was the only room left in the hotel. By this time it was approaching 6am so I told the manager that I was not paying $200+ for a room for 2 hours just to take a shower. All he offered me was 15%off. I told them to forget it and cancel the room and I ended up staying in a friend’s room for the few hours.
reviews.title: Poor rooms and shocking service!

reviews.text: If my friends were not staying here I would have departed and gone to the Raffles Plaza or Ritz, so the next morning I checked in again and was given the original room on the seventh floor that had now been cleaned, on close inspection the room was very tired and in need of renovation and a really good spring clean, dirt on the carpet, marks on the bed cover, hair in the bathroom, mold in the shower and items missing from the mini bar. I returned to the front desk again and spoke with the manager, he said he would upgrade me to a premium deluxe room with a city view but could not give this to me until 1pm, I also managed to get free breakfast out of him for 2nights. When I returned at 1pm it took the incompetent reception staff another 15mins just to give me the key to my new room on the 15th floor, the room was really no different to the original one and didn’t have a city view like promised. I spoke to the manager again and a few hours later I was moved to a city view room. I will never stay at this hotel again, putting aside there false claims of newly renovated rooms, there customer service is just so poor, to get anything out of them was such a mission and were do these hotels get off charging $25+ for the internet.
reviews.title: Great Stay
A bit disappointed
reviews.text: I stayed at this Hotel in August 2006. The stay was excellent. Everything was good. Service, food, rooms, atmosphere were all excellant. But I did not stay there on a weekend. I was told that on Sundays the hang bird cages with live birds in the atrium and one can enjoy the chirping sound of the birds. If true, I will not stay at this hotel again. I DO NOT SUPPORT THAT. I BELIEVE NO ANINMAL OR BIRDS SHOULD BE CAGED.

Stayed here for 2 nights on our return from a trip to Oz. Arrived very tired around 2 a.m. as our flight was delayed and was greeted by a very unfriendly receptionist (not the usual friendly Singaporean welcome!). She said they only had one room left, even though we had paid for and reserved a room weeks ago. We were told that we could be moved the next day if we wished but as we were only going to be staying for two nights we felt sure the room they had to offer us would be sufficient. How wrong we were!!! We were given a tiny room on the 6th floor right next door to a conference room and a break out area for smoking and drinking tea and coffee. The two single beds we were given were very uncomfortable and seemed to be a pull out type bed for children – not the kingsize bed we were expecting. The carpets were stained and the bathroom and room overall was in desperate need of refurbishment. By the next morning and a miserable night’s sleep (even though we were exhausted) we decided that the room was not acceptable even for just another night’s stay. Reception this time was slightly more helpful and offered us a room change to a higher floor later in the day. What a difference 7 floors make! The room was spacious with a good view and a comfortable kingsize bed – this was all we had been expecting from a hotel of this standard. The hotel itself seems a little dated but all the public areas were clean and tidy. Only ate in the hotel once for breakfast which was average. The pool and sun desk was wonderful and the staff there were extremely helpful. The hotel’s location is great but with all the construction going on in the area, it makes it quite difficult to walk above ground from a to b. Unfortunately, our first impressions of this hotel was not great but the second night did make up for it. We would not stay here again, as I think there are many more far superior hotels to choose from in Singapore.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 days/nights and I have to say at times it felt rather surreal almost like being inside "Twin Peaks". Being the Xmas season if one sits in the lounge area there are carols playng in the background but given the open centre design to the building it gives them a surreal echo. Notwithstanding that Singapore hardly has a festive feel about it in a 32degC heat.
reviews.title: Give me a Shotgun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But worst of all were the piped bird sounds.
reviews.title: Great 1 night stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now these seem to be on all day and can be heard everywhere including inside your room. So when I was laying in bed at 8AM then it was unnerving at best and downright annoying at worst - preventing me from dozing off again. I was contemplating ringing the concierge for a shotgun but I guess he wouldn't have got the sarcasm.
reviews.title: Expensive but nice

reviews.text: Apart from this major downer there was one high point but it is possibly a personal thing - corned beef hash at the breakfast buffet! This took me back to camping expeditions as a child/young adult and I couldn't get enough of it. Superbly done. Imagine my disappointment when it wasn't on the counter for the second day of my stay.
reviews.title: Great service staff!

reviews.text: Other points are that the air con is too noisy. The control is either 'on' or 'off' and the 'on' position is too loud to go to sleep. Fortunately the room temperature was OK with the A/C off.
reviews.title: 5-star that is not quite so
